Convergence refers to the similarity between two or more things, whereas divergence refers tothe difference or separation between them. In terms of concept convergence, multiple ideas come together to form an overarching theme. On the other hand, concept divergence highlights the distinct features of various ideas that have started to move apart. For instance, in mathematics, convergent solutions lead to a single solution or outcome, while divergent solutions present multiple outcomes. Similarly, in geography, converging continents result in a continent-wide climate change event. Thus, these two concepts help us understand similarities and differences on a variety of levels.
